tweet: Free-market competition in healthcare drives innovation, lowers costs, and improves quality.
response: The invisible hand fails in healthcare markets. Information asymmetry, inelastic demand, and third-party payments create market failures. Evidence shows systems with regulated prices and universal coverage achieve better outcomes at lower costs than our fragmented approach. Markets work for many things, but healthcare isn't one of them.

tweet: Free-market competition in healthcare drives innovation, lowers costs, and improves quality.
response: Competition in healthcare isn't always beneficial. Many studies show that hospital mergers and consolidation often lead to higher prices without improving quality.
